quizDescription.text: Two events A and B are independent if and only if their joint probability equals the product of their probabilities:
Two events A and B are independent if and only if their joint probability equals the product of their probabilities:
A finite set of events is mutually independent if and only if every event is independent of any intersection of the other events.That is, iff for every subset An
A set of random variables is pairwise independent iff every pair of random variables is independent. That is either joint cumulative distribution function
